intro: Jacobinia sulcata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators like bees and birds. Jacobinia sulcata thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
